Trial_Design.evidence: We included all randomised controlled trials (RCTs) of CLI in which participants were randomly allocated to intramuscular administration of autologous adult BMMNCs or control.

Participants.evidence: We included four RCTs involving a total of 176 participants with a clinical diagnosis of CLI.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either intramuscular cell implantation of BMMNCs or control.

Objective.evidence: To evaluate the benefits and harms of local intramuscular transplantation of autologous adult bone marrow mononuclear cells (BMMNCs) as a treatment for CLI.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Our primary outcomes of interest were all‐cause mortality, pain, and amputation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: We included four RCTs involving a total of 176 participants with a clinical diagnosis of CLI.

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no clear evidence of an effect on mortality related to the administration of BMMNCs compared to control (risk ratio (RR) 1.00, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.15 to 6.63; 3 studies, 123 participants; very low‐certainty evidence).

Harms.evidence: We pooled the data for side effects reported during the follow‐up, and this did not show any clear difference between BMMNC and control groups (RR 2.13, 95% CI 0.50 to 8.97; 4 studies, 176 participants; very low‐certainty evidence).
